citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Natural Resources - Information Resource Management
citeinfo.title: Alaska State Marine Highway

descript.abstract: General representation of the Alaska State Marine Highway system.
descript.purpose: This data set was created for portrayal on large scale maps.
descript.supplinf: Standard Map Depiction: An ArcGIS layer file, downloadable at http://dnr.alaska.gov/lrisservices/ls_proxy/document?static_pickup=alaska_marine_highway.zip, is available for use in creating a standard map rendition.

idinfo.accconst: To ensure distribution of the most current public information, please refer requests for data or products to the Alaska Department of Natural Resources, Information Resource Management.
idinfo.useconst:
The scale varies from 1:2,000,000 to 1:63,360 and is indicated by the scale attribute.
Any hardcopies or published datasets utilizing these data sets shall clearly indicate their source. If the user has modified the data in any way they are obligated to describe the types of modifications they have performed. User specifically agrees not to misrepresent these data sets, nor to imply that changes they made were approved by the Alaska Department of Natural Resources.

cntperp.cntorg: AK Department of Natural Resources - Information Resource Management

dataqual.complete: There may be some routes missing.

procstep.procdesc:
Updated marine hwy from Port Lion to Dutch Harbor by verbal discussion with co-captain of ship. Does not include all routes to those destinations. Also included update from TNF. See History.
From Port Lions to Dutch Harbor - Talked to the co-captain of the ship. He indicated which passages the ferry travels through to their destinations. He did mention they have some variations- depending on weather and time. They sometimes travel ocean side of Kodiak Island on the return trips. The variations are not indicated in this coverage. The scale is approx. 1:1-000-000 or 1:250-000. (SOURCE = 'AMHS-ADNR' for Alaska Marine Highway System and ADNR).
For SE Alaska - Received digital data from the US Forest Service - Tongass National Forest - of their infrastructure. The infrastructure was digitized at 1:63360. Only the marine highways are from this coverage. (SOURCE = 'USFS - TNF')
For Prince William Sound - Used the US Forest Service - Chugach National Forest - hardcopy map- 1978. Approx. scale 1:500-000.FALSE.
For the remainder of the state (Anchorage- Homer- Seldovia) we received the data from USGS DLG files at 1:2-000-000.FALSE.
Dropped the following items as they originated from the DLG and are no longer needed.
Arc: dropitem MARINE_HWYS.AAT MARINE_HWYS.AAT
Enter item names (type END or a blank line when done): Enter the 1st item: NUM Enter the 2nd item: MAJ Enter the 3rd item: MIN Enter the 4th item: MAJ2 Enter the 5th item: MIN2 Enter the 6th item: DXF-LAYER Enter the 7th item: END
Geodatabase feature classes data copied to materialized view.
Materialized view data extracted and converted to Shape format.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
